p: For rice in total tons (Figure 5), fairly modest net production losses in temperate countries are largely attributable to methane, whereas production gains in tropical nations are predominantly driven by CO 2. Aerosols also contribute to rice production gains in tropical countries with high pollution levels, including China, India, and Bangladesh, whereas non‐CO 2 GHGs offset some of the gains from CO 2 and aerosols. In terms of relative yield changes (Figure 6), however, losses in temperate countries are larger in magnitude than gains in tropical nations. This is attributable to both (1) the large positive impact of CO 2 in the tropics compared with a net near‐zero impact in the temperate zones due to the greater sensitivity of rice to fertilization relative to temperature in the tropics (Figure 2) and (2) the larger response of temperate ozone to methane relative to ozone in the tropical countries of Southeast Asia shown in Figure 6.
